data.title: Obion County Teacher Fundraising Debate Interrupts Discussion on Capital Projects for Schools
data.meta_description: An agenda item for school capital projects for Obion County was interrupted with debate over fundraising at this weekâs Budget Committee meeting. During discussion on the list of school capital projects for buildings, Commissioner Rob Holman questioned
data.text:
An agenda item for school capital projects for Obion County was interrupted with debate over fundraising at this weekâs Budget Committee meeting.

During discussion on the list of school capital projects for buildings, Commissioner Rob Holman questioned Director of Schools Tim Watkins about on-line fundraising by teachers.(AUDIO)

https://dehayf5mhw1h7.cloudfront.net/wp-content/uploads/sites/2193/2024/08/07095004/news275m.mp3

Holman continued the debate, calling for Budget Committee members to not vote for infrastructure projects.(AUDIO)

https://dehayf5mhw1h7.cloudfront.net/wp-content/uploads/sites/2193/2024/08/07095712/news278m.mp3

Obion County Schools Finance Director Linda Carney agreed with Director Watkins explanation that fundraising must come through the school.(AUDIO)

https://dehayf5mhw1h7.cloudfront.net/wp-content/uploads/sites/2193/2024/08/07095734/news277m.mp3

(photo: Charles Choate – 104.9 KYTN/105.7 WQAK)
